titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rice University Hillel t-shirts, 2012-2013 UA 343
titlestmt.author: Alan Bath

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-12 09:41:42 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Hillel, the Foundation for Jewish Campus Life

did.abstract: This collection includes t-shirts created by the Rice Hillel community in 2012-2013, with a shirt for each of the Rice University residential colleges, featuring the college name written in Hebrew.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jewish life for Houston's college students started in 1915 with the establishment of the Menorah Society at Rice University. The purpose of the organization, and its successor the Hillel Society, was to bring Jewish students at Rice together in religious, social, cultural, and charitable activities. The Hillel Society of Houston was established at Rice in 1940, under the directorship of Rabbi Robert Kahn and, following the Second World War, at the University of Houston. Houston Hillel is a multi-campus Hillel Foundation, whose mission is "Houston Hillel enriches the lives of Jewish undergraduate students, graduate students and young professionals so that they may enrich the Houston Jewish community, the Jewish people and the world," according to their website located at http://www.houstonhillel.org/ (accessed Jan. 21, 2016). Hillel activities at Rice University are a part of this larger city group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes t-shirts created by the Rice Hillel community in 2012-2013, with a shirt for each of the Rice University residential colleges, featuring the college name written in Hebrew.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.
Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by members of Rice University's Hillel community in 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rice University Hillel t-shirts collection, 2012-2013, UA 343, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also the Hillel "information file" at Woodson Research Center for Hillel newsclippings, event programs and other ephemera.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be facilitated through the Woodson Research Center.
